info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 3:57AM EST until January 10 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...In northwestern Connecticut, Litchfield County, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire County, in east central New York, Albany, Columbia, Dutchess, Greene, Rensselaer, Schoharie, Southern Washington, and Ulster counties, and in southern Vermont, Bennington County. * WHEN...From this evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall and snow melt may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Higher than normal tidal flooding is expected along the Hudson River and its tributaries from around Poughkeepsie to Kingston in areas vulnerable to tidal flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
